metadata.title: CVE-2021-3744 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A memory leak flaw was found in the Linux kernel in theccp_run_aes_gcm_cmd() function in drivers/crypto/ccp/ccp-ops.c, whichallows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption). Thisvulnerability is similar with the older CVE-2019-18808.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3744` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
